intro: Eremocarya micrantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eremocarya, is a shrub native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is well adapted to harsh, dry environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Eremocarya micrantha is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in low-water conditions.
